body: Why do you want to bundle `electron`?
I don't. I'm saying the new version _does_ (at least the index.js file), and that's causing problems.
You need to specify `electron` as `external` if you want to not bundle it

```js
module.exports = {
    entry: './main.js',
    output: {path: __dirname + '/app', filename: 'main.js'},
    target: 'electron-main',
    externalsType: 'commonjs',
    externals: ['electron']
};
```
Do you mean this? That does appear to work, but it's very much a breaking change.

If `target: 'electron-main'` _intentionally_ no longer does this, what's the difference/advantage compared to using `target: 'node'`?
Weird. Can you create reproducible test repo?
hm, no problems with your repo, no `elector` in bundle, same for `target: 'electron-main' only,`, maybe you have globally installed webpack?

Yep it's a bug.

In this line: https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/d10b08b4b5151a02a193b41c63f58589445ae239/lib/electron/ElectronTargetPlugin.js#L34

There is a `.apply(compiler)` missing. (Like [here](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/d10b08b4b5151a02a193b41c63f58589445ae239/lib/electron/ElectronTargetPlugin.js#L53))

Do you want to send a PR?

issue.title: Fix require handling with electron; fixes #11599

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->
<!-- Explain the **motivation** for making this change. What existing problem does the pull request solve? -->
<!-- Try to link to an open issue for more information. -->
This fixes electron/index.js being bundled as described in #11599, and also fixes `electron-renderer` to use the correct chunk format, as it is in a browser and not in a module context.

<!-- In addition to that please answer these questions: -->

Bugfix.
